intro: Senecio tshiturungensis, commonly known as the Tshiturungensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellowish in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
